title: 15.5 Optimal Binary Search Trees
content:
Section 15.5

Optimal Binary Search Trees

Summary

Construct BST minimizing expected search cost given access probabilities.

Key Points

  • Keys have known access probabilities pᵢ
  • Dummy keys for unsuccessful searches with probabilities qᵢ
  • Cost = Σ (depth(kᵢ)+1)·pᵢ + Σ (depth(dᵢ)+1)·qᵢ
  • DP: e[i,j] = minimum cost BST for keys i..j
  • Try each key as root: e[i,j] = min over r of e[i,r-1] + e[r+1,j] + w(i,j)

Example

5 keys with probabilities: DP fills n×n table, backtrace gives optimal tree structure.

Why It Matters

Used in compilers for keyword lookup, dictionary implementations.
